member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.AesGcmSiv
member.summary: Provides AES-GCM-SIV (Galois/Counter Mode with Synthetic Initialization Vector) authenticated encryption. This implementation provides misuse resistance through deterministic encryption.
member.remarks:
AES-GCM-SIV is a deterministic authenticated encryption mode that provides protection against nonce reuse attacks. Unlike standard AES-GCM, reusing a nonce with the same key will not lead to security failures, though it will reveal that the same plaintext was encrypted.
Key requirements: - Must be exactly 32 bytes (256 bits) - Should be generated using a cryptographically secure random number generator
Nonce requirements: - Must be exactly 12 bytes (96 bits) - Can be random or structured (e.g., user ID + counter) - Nonce reuse is safe but reveals message duplication
